intro: Mycaranthes davaensis, commonly known as the Davao mycaranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance.
